intro: Craniotome furcata var. sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim craniotome, is a rare flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
